intro: Cyathocoma bachmannii, commonly known as the Bachmann's cyathocoma, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in shaded undergrowth. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
